meanings.definition: The quality or state of being flexible and graceful in movement.
meanings.sent1: Her litheness on the dance floor was admired by all.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast's litheness allowed her to perform stunning routines.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to mimic the litheness of the ballerina but ended up in a funny tumble.
meanings.sent4: His litheness in dodging obstacles was like a leaf floating on the wind.
meanings.sent5: The litheness of the cheetah as it sprinted across the savanna was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The ability to move easily and gracefully.
meanings.sent1: The dancer's litheness captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's litheness helped him excel in various sports.
meanings.sent3: The penguin envied the litheness of the dolphin in the water.
meanings.sent4: Her litheness in solving problems made her the team's go-to person.
meanings.sent5: The litheness of the acrobat as she flipped through the air was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The state of being agile and nimble.
meanings.sent1: The ninja's litheness allowed him to move swiftly and silently.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel's litheness in climbing trees amazed the onlookers.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to imitate the litheness of the cat but ended up in a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: Her litheness in avoiding conflicts made her a skilled diplomat.
meanings.sent5: The litheness of the gazelle as it leaped across the plains was a marvel of nature.
